unnormalised: IIT Delhi announced the 2nd cutoff list for its M.Tech programs on 25/06/2024. The list, published at 17:00 hrs, showed a slight dip in the qualifying GATE scores compared to Round 1. This year, due to the increased number of applicants, the competition is tougher, says Prof. Rajesh Kumar, the admissions coordinator.
normalised: I-I-T Delhi announced the second cutoff list for its M-Tech programs on twenty fifth june two thousand and twenty four. The list, published at seventeen hundred hours, showed a slight dip in the qualifying G-A-T-E scores compared to Round one. This year, due to the increased number of applicants, the competition is tougher, says Professor Rajesh Kumar, the admissions coordinator.

unnormalised: Candidates are advised to check the official website, iitd.ac.in, for detailed information. Seats are filling up fast, particularly in high-demand programs like Computer Science and Electrical Engineering. Reports suggest that almost 80% of the seats are already confirmed after the 1st round of admissions.
normalised: Candidates are advised to check the official website, i-i-t-d dot a-c dot i-n, for detailed information. Seats are filling up fast, particularly in high-demand programs like Computer Science and Electrical Engineering. Reports suggest that almost eighty percent of the seats are already confirmed after the first round of admissions.

unnormalised: This trend reflects the increasing popularity of technical education among young Indians. "More and more students are now opting for STEM fields, recognizing their potential in the growing Indian economy," commented Dr. Meena Sharma, a career counselor in Mumbai. The deadline to accept the offered seat in Round 2 is 01/07/2024, 11:59 PM.
normalised: This trend reflects the increasing popularity of technical education among young Indians. "More and more students are now opting for S-T-E-M fields, recognizing their potential in the growing Indian economy," commented Doctor Meena Sharma, a career counselor in Mumbai. The deadline to accept the offered seat in Round two is first july two thousand and twenty four, eleven fifty nine P-M.

unnormalised: The cutoff for the CSE program is reported to be 780, down from 800 in the 1st round. For EE, it stands at 750, a decrease of 15 points. Students are anxiously waiting for the next round, scheduled for 08/07/2024, hoping for further relaxation in the criteria.
normalised: The cutoff for the C-S-E program is reported to be seven hundred and eighty, down from eight hundred in the first round. For E-E, it stands at seven hundred and fifty, a decrease of fifteen points. Students are anxiously waiting for the next round, scheduled for eighth july two thousand and twenty four, hoping for further relaxation in the criteria.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, other top institutions like IIT Bombay and IIT Madras are also expected to release their 2nd lists soon. Keep an eye on their websites, folks! Don't miss out on the opportunity to secure your future!
normalised: Meanwhile, other top institutions like I-I-T Bombay and I-I-T Madras are also expected to release their second lists soon. Keep an eye on their websites, folks! Don't miss out on the opportunity to secure your future!

unnormalised: Good luck, aspirants! May you all get into the program of your dreams! The competition is fierce, but remember hard work and dedication always pay off. Stay positive and keep checking for updates.
normalised: Good luck, aspirants! May you all get into the program of your dreams! The competition is fierce, but remember hard work and dedication always pay off. Stay positive and keep checking for updates.

unnormalised: Remember that the 3rd and final list will be published on 15/07/24.
normalised: Remember that the third and final list will be published on fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four.
